title: Four Horsemen of Meaning- Jordan Peterson, Vervaeke, Pageau...Psychedelics & Christianity?
description:
I've been taking some time to do some theological responses to the recent conversation between @Jordan B Peterson @John Vervaeke @Bishop Robert Barron and @Jonathan Pageau .  This is part 3 in that series.
There was a section of the conversation I could not neglect. Jordan Peterson thinks the New Testament book of Revelation is the result of a psychedelic experience. Is there evidence to support that claim? And what about his admiration for "The Immortality Key" book and the author's claims about Communion wine being a psychedelic mixture?

Why aren't more Christian theologians grappling with psychedelics and their potentiality for producing transformative, mystical experiences?

For Part 1:
https://youtu.be/aaOmcgN3_Sc

Part 2:
https://youtu.be/IbhoIOtPZwg

For my first convo with John Vervaeke:
https://youtu.be/7xX7DWZjmFc

____________
About me:
Paul Anleitner holds degrees in history from the University of Michigan & a Master's in Christian Thought from Bethel Seminary (St. Paul, MN) where he graduated with highest honors.

He's taught theology, philosophy, and biblical studies courses for over a decade and is a pastor with 15 years of experience working in a variety of denominational contexts.
____________

For the Deep Talks: Exploring Theology & Meaning-Making audio podcast:
https://deeptalkstheologypodcast.podb...

To support my channel and podcast:
https://www.patreon.com/deeptalkstheo...

 

Connect with Paul Anleitner on Twitter at:
https://twitter.com/PaulAnleitner
